message: WAH!, This particular moment has lived rent free in my head for a while. The way Ina sings it does it for me, its just so silly and cute at the same time.
It didn't feel like a joke, more like an heartfelt shout

Tbh there were a lot of "favorite" Ina moments for me, between times that were really fun and cool, like when she shot arrows towards IRyS and Polka in Minecraft and drew a heart, and times when she really made me tear up as I was listening to her karaoke performances, like her Kokoro no Soba ni. But maybe this moment I linked was one of the ones that were so impressive to me that whenever I get asked about "who's Ina" or "what's her content about" by others, is this moment that comes to mind, and how she turned 180 degrees the feeling of her drawing in like 15 minutes at the end of the stream, with all the lighting and the perspective she went for... was amazing.

As a final word for my dear priestess I'll just say the classic takodachi shout "Love you Ina!", and always will.
Inaaaaaaa! Wahhh! Daisukiiiiii!!

That one time I got to hear Ina laugh at a pun I wrote in chat and had me smiling for days on end, volume 2.

I can't believe volume 1 got an anime adaptation.
Takobocchi is adorable and she needs a hug. The Takodachi will always be here to support you Ina!

its the excuse i say to my friends that have boing boings üßçüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è; hewwo inya! tenchu for 4 yrs of WAH. its always a comfort tuning in your streams as i am a shy casual tako. more years of WAH-shing away our brain cells with puns (get it‚Ä¶ wah‚Ä¶shing‚Ä¶ im sorry)

I am not really a hololive veteran, so when this moment got clipped and uploaded I think I was just starting to get into the fanbase. But besides that, I think this clip just showed me how casual the whole thing was, with close friends being comfortable to share their past stories so openly here. And the story itself is fairly funny too, what with ina getting beat up completely effortlessly by sana. Overall, it was a funny moment that made me laugh and adjust into this fanbase, and it‚Äôs one of the moments that come to mind when I think of Ina.
This is the calmest and the comfiest stream ive seen on game that is all about rage, and I wanted to channel the same attitude in to my dota games.

I was having an off day and her reading my SC and giving a silly answer really helped my day get better and I think back on it every so often. Ina's streams are always so comfy and are great to listen/watch after a day of work. She's so kind and can be pretty witty with her puns!
I just love how well she countered Gura in this moment, it was so memorable.

Through this moment Ina gained all the color back. I look back to this moment very often to just see how far Ina has gotten, and what she has been through. I shed a couple of tears for our priestess each time I watch through that part, if you're reading this Ina keep doing what you're doing, dream big, and achieve those big dreams! WAH!

message: It's a bit personal for me but knowing that I have contributed to it made me feel very happy and accomplished, especially when she had it as her wallpaper for a while. It was also one of the first times I really tried making something for my oshi. I'm not much of an artist but I wanted to try drawing for her for this project and I had fun making it too. And that makes me appreciate Ina so much because she's able to inspire us to better ourselves. And for my message for Ina, I'm really happy that I met you 4 years ago. You did so much for me and my friend. We could really relate to pretty much all of your hobbies like fate and gundam as well as your humor. It's always have a fun and comfy with your streams. Thank you so much for all your hard work these past few years! I'll continue supporting you!

But I still hope that she can have a good rest after her stream and all events.

message: It was such a random skill to be able to play unraveled on the recorder! Overall the stream was really fun and love when Ina and other members come up with these unique stream ideas :) Happy 4th Anniversary! WAH!
The moment answers the question of what floors Ina chooses to sleep on and the criteria to choose worthy floors. Very important research in sleeping on floors humu humu

‚ÄúYou can‚Äôt help but to be more critical of yourself with what‚Äôs done because, you know, there‚Äôs always that potential of ‚ÄòWhat if I did this?‚Äô or ‚ÄòWhat if I didn‚Äôt do this?‚Äô is ever right. But it‚Äôs when you, I guess somehow just have to step back and be like, ‚ÄòThat has happened. You gotta admit it. It happened, it‚Äôs done. You can‚Äôt go back. What can I do now?‚Äô Hahaha. It doesn‚Äôt mean you wanna forget the past, you just acknowledged that its happened and it‚Äôs there and you‚Äôve presented it to yourself and be like, ‚ÄòOkay. Do I want this to continue? Or do I want this to change?‚Äô Humu humu.‚Äù

Not gonna lie, looking back, when I was just a clips watcher, one of the reasons I started watching you regularly besides I really love how chill your streams are, is because of how wise your words are. Your mindset inspires me to better myself, especially when it comes to controlling my emotions.

There are so many Ina of the Mountain (or, in this stream, Ina of the Onigiri) quotes, but I chose this one because it resonates with me deeply (and kinda a hard slap for me in a way, haha). As an overthinker, I often doubt myself and get demotivated to do things, especially when trying new stuffs, because I really fear them. But you taught me to just take the first step, have confidence, and if things don‚Äôt go perfectly, learn from it and improve for next time. As life is all about learning.

I just want to sincerely thank you, Ina, for inspiring us to become better versions of ourselves. Be proud of all you‚Äôve done. You, Myth, and everyone have never failed to bring smiles to our faces. So, Happy 4th Anniversary! Here‚Äôs to more amazing times!

(PS: Please remember to take care of yourself too. We takos sometimes do worry about your sleep schedule and whether you‚Äôre eating well, lol. Love ya, our tako priestess!)

message:
It was at that moment I realized why I kept returning to Ina's channel more than anywhere else. Having a place to return to became really important for my mental well-being during a difficult time in my life that followed soon after.
I owed her a huge bowl of chicken noodle soup that I could never repay.
It's been a long time when myth girls have off-collab, was so happy seeing them enjoying themselves.The join-in of Goomba makes me wanna cry
Honestly, I like all the stories of Ina getting and giving hugs out to other members, but this one I remember fondly because of Ina's wish to give them all hugs one day during the anniversary.

My pick is Ina's "fuwa fuwa time" from her first anniversary! The first year was a chaotic and fun a roller coaster and this karaoke with everyone chanting tako tako time celebrating miraculously preserving will always hold a dear place in my heart! It is so hard to pick just 1 moment, these 4 years have been filled with many many fun memories! Let's keep having fun together, here's to many more years of takotime!
A great drawing stream about different hairstyles, I always tune into Ina's drawing streams so comfy and relaxing.
The moment she beats Hollow knight is burned in my memory, was a very fun journey and the last part versus the radiance was such a release of emotions

So many favorite moments... watching Ina is always fun! Every moment is my favorite!

But if I had to choose‚Äîman, that's hard‚Äîso I picked two. The first is when my silly joke drawing prediction of Ina's cooking outfit was featured on stream! I actually couldn't believe it, since I submitted it quite late, and it was just a cute/silly thing, but Ina liked it! Ina and the Takos love for cookies is eternal and infinite; the cookie dress sure looked edible, heh.

Also, when she performed "~(if ~Hitori Omou~)" during her 3D showcase, I was actually stunned, shocked, I exploded, melted, died, and revived! FE is one of my favorite franchises, and I love that song so much. Seeing Ina dance and sing it so gracefully, so adorably... was incredible.

Man, I love Ina. She's really a great inspiration for me, and I'm sure she is for all of us Takos. She brought us together, and gave us so many fun moments. Our priestess is amazing!

Happy 4th Anniversary!!
I love "OI." moments. Happy Anniversary Inaaaaaaaaaa WAH
wah: i don't remember much, but WAH.
